intro: Lippia hastulata, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and clusters of small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Lippia hastulata is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and colorful blooms.
